(5.7, 6 bolts, 30m-35m) Up the slab following bolts and then trending right to a pair of bolts at about 30m that is the belay station for The Sage. A few meters farther gets you to another pair of bolts with chains for rappelling.



Starts on the obvious slab in the Upper Amphitheatre. This route gives access to the base of several other routes.


Bolted. No Rap Hangers yet, but we have left behind carabiners on regular hangers for rappelling.Â This station is now equipped with chains for rappelling!! And there is a new rap station straight down from here on a small-ish ledge near the tree, so you can do 2 raps with a single 60m rope. Yeah!

Climb Bath House Slab to get to the base of this climb. It starts at a pair of bolts, just past the corner. (5.11a, 10 bolts, 26m) Climb up from the belay, clipping a bolt out to the left. Continue up and traverse left across the corner, clipping the second bolt. Follow the bolts up the left face, and puzzle out the sequence to the crux(s)! Enjoy the lovely finger crack section towards the top! Belay at the ring bolts on the ledge. Bolted. Rap Hangers at the top so that you can rappel down.

(5.9, 6 bolts, 20m) Traverse left and then up to the first bolt and follow the bolts to the cave! Be extra careful until you have that 2nd bolt clipped! At the top of the route there is 1 bolt in the roof of the cave that can be used as a directional over right to the next station where there are ring bolts. Enjoy the views!!

There are 3 bolted stations in the cave now and you could set up top ropes to climb the terrain beneath each of them.



Far left side of the Upper Amphitheatre Cave.

Bolted. 6 bolts.
This crag is north facing and mostly shady, but also protected from the wind!  It is great on a hot summer day!
